greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Concatenate subsequences 0, 1, 2, 4, ..., 2^k.
comment: A sequence B is called a reluctant sequence of sequence A, if B is triangle array read by rows: row number k coincides with first k elements of the sequence A. Sequence A140531 is the reluctant sequence of A131577. - _Boris Putievskiy_, Dec 12 2012
link: Boris Putievskiy, Transformations Integer Sequences And Pairing Functions arXiv:1212.2732 [math.CO]
formula: a(n) = floor(2^((n-2-t(t+1)/2)), where t=floor((-1+sqrt(8*n-7))/2), n>=1. - _Boris Putievskiy_, Dec 13 2012
results.author: _Paul Curtz_, Jul 03 2008
